etymologies: Old English studu, stuthu ‘post, upright prop’; related to German stützen ‘to prop’. The sense ‘ornamental metal knob’ arose in late Middle English

definitions: a large-headed piece of metal that pierces and projects from a surface, especially for decoration.
shortDefinitions: large-headed piece of metal that pierces and projects from surface

definitions: an item of jewelry in the form of a piece of metal, precious stone, or other ornament attached to a pin or shaft that passes through a piercing in the body

examples.text: she wore a pair of gold studs
he had studs in his nose and lower lip

shortDefinitions: item of jewellery in form of piece of metal etc. attached to pin that passes through body piercing

definitions: a fastener consisting of two buttons joined with a bar, used in formal wear to fasten a shirtfront or to fasten a collar to a shirt
shortDefinitions: fastener consisting of two buttons joined with bar, used in formal wear to fasten shirt front

definitions: a small projection fixed to the base of footwear, especially athletic shoes, to allow the wearer to grip the ground.
shortDefinitions: small projection fixed to base of footwear

definitions: a small metal piece set into the tire of a motor vehicle to improve roadholding in slippery conditions.
shortDefinitions: small metal piece set into tyre of motor vehicle

definitions: an upright support in the wall of a building to which sheathing, drywall, etc., are attached

examples.text: lath and plaster on timber studs

shortDefinitions: upright timber in wall of building

definitions: the height of a room as indicated by the length of a timber wall stud.
shortDefinitions: height of room as indicated by length of timber wall stud

definitions: a rivet or crosspiece in each link of a chain cable.
shortDefinitions: rivet or crosspiece in each link of chain cable

definitions: decorate or augment (something) with many studs or similar small objects

examples.text: a dagger studded with precious diamonds

shortDefinitions: decorate or augment something with many studs or similar small objects

definitions: strew or cover (something) with a scattering of small objects or features

examples.text: the sky was clear and studded with stars

shortDefinitions: scatter or cover something with many small objects or features

etymologies: Old English stōd, of Germanic origin; related to German Stute ‘mare’, also to stand

definitions: an establishment where horses or other domesticated animals are kept for breeding

examples.text: the horse was retired to stud

shortDefinitions: establishment where horses or other domesticated animals are kept for breeding

definitions: a collection of horses or other domesticated animals belonging to one person

examples.text: he kept a large stud of racehorses

shortDefinitions: collection of horses or other domesticated animals belonging to one person

definitions: a young man thought to be very active sexually or regarded as a good sexual partner
shortDefinitions: young man thought to be very active sexually or regarded as good sexual partner

definitions: a form of poker in which the first card of a player's hand is dealt face down and the others face up, with betting after each round of the deal.
shortDefinitions: form of poker in which first card of player's hand is dealt face down and others face up, with betting after each round of deal
